title: NCREC Leandro Bortolon: Resilience of Cropping Systems

tasks.task: Increase resilience in cropping systems in North Dakota.
subtasks: Increase no-till practices to conserve water and reduce evaporation.
Utilize cover crops in late summer and fall to improve soil structure.
Avoid planting too deep (more than recommended depth) to prevent soil crusting.
Manage planting speed to prevent soil crusting and ensure proper crop emergence.

tasks.task: Increase no-till in the cropping system.
subtasks: Set up no-till planting equipment.
Adjust no-till equipment settings for optimal performance.
Ensure soil is left undisturbed between crops.

tasks.task: Utilize cover crops in late summer and fall.
subtasks: Select appropriate cover crop species for local conditions.
Prepare soil for cover crop planting after cash crops.
Plant cover crops at the right time before frost.
Manage cover crops until they die off (for nitrogen fixation, etc.)
Check and adjust planting equipment depth settings.
Monitor planting depth during operations to ensure consistency.

tasks.task: Manage planting speed to prevent crusting.
subtasks: Adjust planter speed according to field conditions.
Use GPS guidance for consistent speed.

tasks.task: I feel confident with these tasks and subtasks. Only thing is rechecking whether "cover crops" is considered a separate task or part of building the resilient system. But since the transcript directly mentions utilizing cover crops as a strategy, and lists it alongside no-till as separate methods, I'll keep each as separate MAINTASKs.
